item.description: ðŸ‘‹ Welcome This is where I put whatever Iâ€™m currently reading or interested in â€” mostly papers, notes, and personal reflections.

item.title: A Comprehensive Review of Recommender Systems - Transitioning from Theory to Practice
item.description: Abstract Recommender Systems (RS) play an integral role in enhancing user experiences by providing personalized item suggestions.

item.title: Adaptive Multi-Modalities Fusion in Sequential Recommendation Systems
item.description: Abstract In sequential recommendation, multi-modal information (e.g., text or image) can provide a more comprehensive view of an itemâ€™s profile.

item.title: Bayesian Knowledge-driven Critiquing with Indirect Evidence
item.description: Abstract Conversational recommender systems (CRS) enhance the expressivity and personalization of recommendations through multiple turns of user-system interaction.

item.title: Bias Reduction News Recommendation System
item.description: Abstract News recommender systems (NRS) are crucial for helping users navigate the vast amount of content available online.

item.title: DiffKG - Knowledge Graph Diffusion Model for Recommendation
item.description: Abstract Knowledge Graphs (KGs) have emerged as invaluable resources for enriching recommendation systems by providing a wealth of factual information and capturing semantic relationships among items.

item.title: Dynamic Graph Neural Networks for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: Abstract Modeling user preference from his historical sequences is one of the core problems of sequential recommendation.

item.title: Explainable Fairness in Recommendation
item.description: Abstract Existing research on fairness-aware recommendation has mainly focused on the quantification of fairness and the development of fair recommendation models, neither of which studies a more substantial problemâ€”identifying the underlying reason of model disparity in recommendation.

item.title: Fairness among New Items in Cold Start Recommender Systems
item.description: Abstract This paper investigates recommendation fairness among new items.

item.title: Frequency Enhanced Hybrid Attention Network for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: Abstract The self-attention mechanism, which equips with a strong capability of modeling long-range dependencies, is one of the extensively used techniques in the sequential recommendation field.
